marketNews.title: GOTO: Target Adjusted EBITDA Rp1.4-1.6 T in 2025
marketNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) management targets an adjusted EBITDA of approximately 1.4-1.6 trillion rupiah during 2025, with the 'On-Demand Services (ODS)' segment projected to contribute a minimum of 1.1 trillion rupiah and the 'Fintech' segment contributing a minimum of 350 billion rupiah. This target was announced after GOTO recorded a positive adjusted EBITDA* of 399 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: positive 89 billion rupiah, 3Q24: positive 137 billion rupiah). This result brought the adjusted EBITDA for 2024 to a positive 386 billion rupiah (vs. 2023: negative 2.3 trillion rupiah), exceeding the company's guidance which targeted breakeven. On the bottom line, net loss decreased to 1.1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: net loss 80.4 trillion rupiah, 3Q24: net loss 655 billion rupiah), resulting in a net loss for 2024 of 3.1 trillion rupiah (vs. 2023: net loss 87 trillion rupiah). Progress is Projected to Continue in 2025: The 'ODS' segment posted an adjusted EBITDA of positive 267 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +71% QoQ) - the highest level ever achieved - driven by revenue growth and improved margins. GOTO management targets the growth of the 'ODS' segment this year to be in line with the industry, which is projected to grow low-mid teens in 2025. GOTO management continues to innovate to support the growth of the ODS segment by relying on its technology - such as the special delivery fleet program which results in more efficient costs, allowing it to offer competitive pricing to customers - and continues to boost advertising revenue (+92% YoY in 4Q24). In the 'Fintech' segment, the amount of financing increased again and stood at 5.2 trillion rupiah as of the end of 2024 (vs. 9M24: 4.3 trillion rupiah, 2023: 1.9 trillion rupiah). GOTO management also targets financing to reach more than 8 trillion rupiah by the end of 2025. Management also explained that asset quality is in quite good condition, without detailing specific metrics. Management explained that the short loan tenor (average of 3 months excluding vehicle financing) allows the company to adapt quickly to changing situations. Corporate Action Update: Regarding buybacks, GOTO management stated that the company has repurchased 23.6 billion shares with a value of approximately 91 million US dollars or 1.5 trillion rupiah as of the end of February 2025. This value indicates an average purchase price of ~64 rupiah per share. For context, GOTO allocated a share buyback budget of 200 million US dollars. Regarding reports of a planned merger with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), management again stated that they could not comment and chose to remain focused on executing strategy, considering the potential market is still large. Finally, regarding the plan to provide holiday allowances (THR) for partners, management explained that THR will be given to productive and high-performing partners. The company will also manage the additional costs within the existing plan. *Note: This is a pro-forma figure assuming the deconsolidation of Tokopedia and related businesses as of January 1, 2023, which we believe provides a better performance comparison. Key Takeaway: With the performance run rate shown in 4Q24, we consider the target adjusted EBITDA of around 1.4-1.6 trillion rupiah during 2025 to be a realistic target to achieve. Risks to achieving the target potentially come from weakening purchasing power, which could lead to increased competition as consumers become more price-sensitive. Meanwhile, potential upside may emerge from increasingly efficient operating costs, thereby increasing margins again.

marketNews.title: Gold Prices Hit All-Time High Amid Tariff Uncertainty and Recession Fears
marketNews.content: Gold prices in the spot market rose +1.6% to level 2,977.36 US dollars per troy ounce in Thursday (13/3) night trading, marking an all-time high. This price increase was driven by uncertainty over tariff policies from US President Donald Trump, as well as increasing expectations for monetary easing in the US amidst recession concerns due to the trade war.

marketNews.title: Forestry Carbon Trading to be Inaugurated Soon
marketNews.content: Minister of Forestry, Raja Juli Antoni, said on Thursday (13/3) that carbon trading from the forestry sector will soon be inaugurated, with the government currently striving to recognize existing international standards. In the initial stage, this carbon trading covers forest management schemes by private entities and social forestry. Raja Antoni claimed that the potential for carbon trading in the forestry sector in 2025 is estimated to reach 26.5 million tons of CO2 with transaction values ranging from 1.6-3.2 trillion rupiah per year.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Issues Telco Permit for Some Apple iPhone 16 Series
marketNews.content: Director at the Ministry of Communication and Digital Affairs, Dwi Handoko, said that his office has issued 5 postel certifications for the iPhone 16 series, meaning that Apple products (Nasdaq: AAPL) now only require import permits from the Ministry of Trade before they can be sold in Indonesia. The government began processing the permit application for the sale of the iPhone 16 series after reaching an investment agreement with Apple at the end of February 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Predicted to Have Normal Dry Season This Year, Says Agency
marketNews.content: Deputy for Climatology at BMKG, Ardhasena Sopaheluwakan, said on Thursday (13/3) that Indonesia is expected to experience a normal dry season in 2025, following the same pattern as last year. The dry season will start in most regions in April and is expected to peak in June-August.

tickerNews.title: SMRA 2024: Net Profit +79% YoY, Exceeds Expectations
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded a net profit of 440 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+289% YoY, +144% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah (+79% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equaled 116% of the consensus estimate. Although the gross profit margin in 4Q24 shrank to 47.8% (-260 bps YoY, -640 bps QoQ), revenue growth significantly higher than opex succeeded in pushing the operating profit margin to 30.8% (+800 bps YoY, +130 bps QoQ). Strong revenue growth in 4Q24 was mainly due to revenue recognition in the residential segment (+220% YoY, +125% QoQ). Through this financial report, SMRA also conveyed that its business entity, which was previously planned for an IPO, PT Summarecon Investment Property, has changed its status from a public company to a private company because the initial public offering (IPO) has not yet been carried out.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Dividend Final Cum Date Set for March 20, Payment on April 11, 2025
tickerNews.content: BBCA: Bank Central Asia announced that the cum date for the final dividend in the regular and negotiated market falls on March 20, 2025, with payment on April 11, 2025. Previously, BBCA shareholders approved the distribution of the 2024 final dividend amounting to 250 rupiah per share mid-week, indicating a final dividend yield of 2.9% as of Friday (14/3). BBCA also distributed an interim dividend of 50 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Conducts First Shipment of 6,500 Tons of Nickel MHP Product
tickerNews.content: President Director of Merdeka Battery Materials, Teddy Oetomo, said that his company conducted the first shipment of nickel mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) product amounting to 6,500 tons in March 2025. The shipment originated from the HPAL smelter owned by PT ESG New Energy Material, which is a joint venture between the company and GEM Co. Ltd. The PT ESG New Energy Material smelter has a production capacity of 30,000 tons of nickel MHP per year.

tickerNews.title: BBTN in Talks with Foreign Investors for Up to $400 Million Global Bond Issuance for MBR Housing Loans
tickerNews.content: President Director of Bank Tabungan Negara, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said that his company held meetings with foreign investors regarding the issuance of global bonds up to 400 million US dollars or approximately 6.5 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended to support the distribution of housing loans (KPR) for low-income communities (MBR). Previously, Nixon stated at the end of 2024 that the company planned to issue bonds of about 10-15 trillion rupiah throughout 2025 to meet liquidity needs for KPR distribution.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Targets Completion of Tanjung Enim-Kramasan Coal Transportation Expansion in Q3 2026
tickerNews.content: President Director of Bukit Asam, Arsal Ismail, said that the company targets the development of the Tanjung Enim-Kramasan coal transportation to be completed in Q3 2026. Arsal mentioned that the development of this coal transportation will increase the company's production capacity by 20 million tons per year.

tickerNews.title: CLEO to Sell All Buyback Shares to Controller Gradually Starting March 21, 2025
tickerNews.content: Sariguna Primatirta announced it will sell all buyback shares amounting to approximately 40 million shares to its controller, PT Tancorp Global Abadi, gradually starting March 21, 2025. However, the company did not specify the selling price for these shares.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Sees Flat YoY Growth in February 2025 Due to Java Floods
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume growth of +0.5% YoY in February 2025, with market share dropping to 28.6% (vs. January 2025: 31%, February 2024: 29.9%) as industry-wide sales volume rose +5% YoY. The annual growth tends to be flat due to rain and floods in the Java region, which accounts for 65% of the company's total sales volume. INTP's sales volume in February 2025 was supported by Central Java (+2.7% YoY) amidst a volume decrease in West Java (-2.7% YoY). By product segmentation, pocketed cement sales volume grew +3.3% YoY and bulk cement weakened -5.9% YoY in February 2025, mainly due to normalization of demand in the State Capital (IKN) area. Over 2M25, INTP's sales volume fell -0.1% YoY, which is better than the industry decline of -0.4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Conducts Capital Injection for 16.67% Ownership in PT Dextone Lemindo
tickerNews.content: Avia Avian (AVIA) conducted a capital injection amounting to 276 billion rupiah for a 16.67% stake in PT Dextron Lemindo through new share issuance. This transaction is aimed at developing the company's business activities and product portfolio in the adhesive/glue industry sector.

tickerNews.title: TEBE Controller increases stake to 24.52%
tickerNews.content: The controller of Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE), PT Dua Samudera Perkasa, purchased approximately 114 million TEBE shares at a price of 500 rupiah per share on March 12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 57 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa's ownership in TEBE increased from 15.63% to 24.52%.

tickerNews.title: HILL Controller Reduces Stake Slightly to 59.32%
tickerNews.content: The controller of Hillcon (HILL), PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold approximately 7.5 million HILL shares at a price of 2,100 rupiah per share on March 12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 15.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL decreased from 59.57% to 59.32%.
